TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NamedPipeServerStream extends System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream

Attribute.AttributeName: System.MonoTODO("working only on win32 right now")

remarks.para: Named pipes provide one-way or duplex pipes for communication between a pipe server and one or more pipe clients. Named pipes can be used for interprocess communication locally or over a network. A single pipe name can be shared by multiple objects.
Any process can act as either a named pipe server or client, or both.

block.para: For winxppro and win2kserver, a maximum of 10 pipes can simultaneously connect over the network.

summary.para: Exposes a around a named pipe, supporting both synchronous and asynchronous read and write operations.

MemberSignature.Value: public IAsyncResult BeginWaitForConnection (AsyncCallback callback, object state);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.IAsyncResult BeginWaitForConnection(class System.AsyncCallback callback, object state) cil managed

remarks.para: This is the asynchronous equivalent of .
must be called exactly once for every call to .

summary.para: Begins an asynchronous operation to wait for a client to connect.

returns.para: An object that references the asynchronous request.

Docs.param: The method to call when a client connects to the object.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Disconnect ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Disconnect() cil managed

remarks.para: Calling the method will block until all the sent characters have been read unless the transmission mode of the pipe is set to and the buffer size is set in the constructor that created the object. In this case, not all of the messages will be received. Calling causes the server to block until all the data has been read from the pipe.

MemberSignature.Value: public void EndWaitForConnection (IAsyncResult asyncResult);
.method public hidebysig instance void EndWaitForConnection(class System.IAsyncResult asyncResult) cil managed

remarks.para: must be called exactly once for every call to .

summary.para: Ends an asynchronous operation to wait for a client to connect.

Docs.param: The pending asynchronous request.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetImpersonationUserName ();
.method public hidebysig instance string GetImpersonationUserName() cil managed

remarks.para: The method returns null if the client has not yet written to the pipe or if the connected client did not connect with a of .

summary.para: Gets the user name of the client on the other end of the pipe.

returns.para: The user name of the client on the other end of the pipe.

MemberSignature.Value: public const int MaxAllowedServerInstances = -1;
.field public static literal int32 MaxAllowedServerInstances = (-1)

remarks.para: Use the when creating a object to set the maximum number of server instances that the system resources allow.

summary.para: Represents the maximum number of server instances that the system resources allow.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RunAsClient (System.IO.Pipes.PipeStreamImpersonationWorker impersonationWorker);
.method public hidebysig instance void RunAsClient(class System.IO.Pipes.PipeStreamImpersonationWorker impersonationWorker) cil managed

remarks.para: The connecting client's permissions are applied to the remote server. For example, if the connecting client tries to request the contents of a file on the server, the client can request only files that it has sufficient permissions to open.

summary.para: Calls a delegate while impersonating the client.

Docs.param: The delegate that specifies a method to call.

MemberSignature.Value: public void WaitForConnection ();
.method public hidebysig instance void WaitForConnection() cil managed

remarks.para: Calling this method causes the object to block until a client connects.

summary.para: Waits for a client to connect to this object.
